messages.title: Save our NHS
messages.content: Labour saved the NHS before. We can do it again.

messages.title: The NHS – Our stories
messages.content: The dedicated staff have cared for my eldest nephew when he had a rare childhood cancer and they used pioneering techniques to save his life.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Labour believes other parties can only promise, whereas Labour saved the NHS before and can save it again. They plan to repeal the Health and Social Care Act so that hospitals can work together rather than competing for profits, ensure that by 2020, patients have to wait half the time for a GP, and stop the government from privatising more NHS services.

mentions.candidate: Thangam Debbonaire talked to local GPs.
mentions.otherPartyLeaderCandidate: Andy Burnham, Labour’s Shadow Health Secretary, mentioned.

issues.health: Thangam Debbonaire says, 'Labour saved the NHS before. We can do it again.'

leaflet.personalStatement: I'm standing to be our Labour MP because we must not lose the NHS and only Labour can be trusted to ensure it is there for us when we need it.

endorsements.endorsement: Val has worked for the NHS for 50 years, says, 'I know Thangam Debbonaire will work to bring respect for the Health workers with Burnham.'

quotes.text: Labour introduced Agenda for Change – a fair way to pay NHS staff – governed by an independent national pay review body...Staff at the BRI told Thangam – ‘NHS pay has been cut by 12% - 15% since 2010’

People were queueing up to sign our petition to save the NHS. They don’t want to see it sold off to make profits for private companies. Labour saved the NHS before and we will do it again if you give us the chance.

images.caption: Thangam Debbonaire with supporters and constituents advocating for the NHS.
Local GPs discussing the state of the NHS with Thangam Debbonaire.
Thangam Debbonaire at the Bristol Royal Hospital for Children.
